page.title: 07Cattle at Upper Lutheredge.
page.content: Cattle are bought from dairy farmers at{6}months of age.They are then kept for a further{18}months. The beef cattle are put into two different age groups.The young cattle vary in age from 1-18 months, and the older cattle are aged between 18 months and 2 years.When they reach 2 years they are taken to the slaughter house in Malmesbury.In Winter the cattle are kept in barns,and in the Summer they graze in the fields on the hillside. The farmer crossbreeds cattle. The black white-faced heifer's father is a Hereford and the mother is a Friesian.The pure black ones have an Aberdeen Angus for a father. The farmer's sons feed the cattle in the morning.Formerly the straw bales were rectangular but now they are circular.Each weighs 2-3kilos and is 1.25 metres high.
